clinical_study.brief_title: Predictive Ability of PEEP Induced Changes in CVP to Predict Volume Responsiveness in Mechanically Ventilated Patients After Major Abdominal Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Predictive Ability of PEEP Induced CVP Changes to Predict Volume Responsiveness in Mechanically Ventilated Patients After Major Abdominal Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Interventional study which will assess whether an positive end expiratory pressure induced increase of central venous pressure is a valid predictor of volume responsiveness in mechanically ventilated patients after major abdominal surgery assessed by increase of cardiac output after passive leg raise.

detailed_description.textblock: Interventional study which will assess whether an positive end expiratory pressure induced increase of central venous pressure is a valid predictor of volume responsiveness in mechanically ventilated patients after major abdominal surgery assessed by increase of cardiac output after passive leg raise.

primary_outcome.measure: Stroke volume increase after passive leg raise
primary_outcome.description: Patients who have a stroke volume (measured in ml) increase of 7% or more after passive leg raise will be considered volume responsive. After the patients have been stratified into volume responders and volume non-responders, sensitivity and specificity of PEEP induced increase in CVP and pulse pressure variation will be assessed and further statistical analysis will be performed.

arm_group.description: After ICU admission the patient's hemodynamics (MAP, HR, CO, PPV) will be measured in supine position. It will be remeasured after PEEP has been increased from +5 to +15 cmH20. Then the baseline measurement will be repeated. Then passive leg raise will be performed and all the parameters will be remeasured.

intervention.description: PEEP increase +5 to +15 cmH2O. PLR at 30 degrees.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mechanically ventilated and sedated patients admitted to the ICU after major abdominal surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Heart failure NYHA III or more
- Severe obstructive or restrictive lung disease
- Hypotension with MAP < 60 mmHg
- Tachycardia > 140 beats / min

overall_official.affiliation: Anesthesiologist and Intensive care medicine specialist

results_reference.citation: Geerts BF, Aarts LP, Groeneveld AB, Jansen JR. Predicting cardiac output responses to passive leg raising by a PEEP-induced increase in central venous pressure, in cardiac surgery patients. Br J Anaesth. 2011 Aug;107(2):150-6. doi: 10.1093/bja/aer125. Epub 2011 May 27.
